result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel L. Nelson-Ashford

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. Atty Joseph Kaupie appears on behalf of deft. Parties request additional PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact with co-defendant(s): James Schneider. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

2:07 p.m.
Clerk Micki. 

State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher for ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, with Attorney Adam Fontana.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $2,000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with co-defendant(s): James Schneider.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Dates:
PTC-9/27/22 at 11:30 a.m.

Branch 3.

ADJ: 2:12 p.m.
